title: How Money Flowed (and Ebbed) at GE
description: A giant, vertical streamograph rendered using D3. I’m most proud of this piece for the mobile-friendly solution to incorporating annotations into such a dense chart.

title: Midterm Elections 2018: Live Results
description: I led a team who worked on this results page, plus live graphics embedded within the WSJ homepage, app and election night liveblog. My biggest contribution to the codebase was the ‘Pachinko’, a novel data visualisation that uses animation in a fun way.

title: 4,925 Tweets: Elon Musk's Twitter Habit, Dissected
description: I worked closely with Scott and Samarth to find the right format for this analysis of Elon Musk’s tweets. We settled on a trendy ‘tap story’ with lot of charts and embedded tweets.

title: How Facial Recognition Software Works
description: This interactive explainer uses a JavaScript library called clmtracker for live face-tracking and rudimentary emotion detection. It uses web media APIs that were cutting-edge at the time and so may no longer work correctly in some browsers.

title: Lives Lost in Three Decades of School Shootings
Bull’s Birthday
description: How stocks are doing eight years after hitting their crisis-era low.

title: Bull’s Birthday
description: How stocks are doing eight years after hitting their crisis-era low.

title: Markets Splinter
description: Correlations are breaking down in the wake of the U.S. election, ending a long period in which assets’ tendency to cluster frustrated traders.

title: Has the Dow Hit 20000 Yet?
description: Tongue-in-cheek tracker of the market milestone.

title: U.S. Election Results 2016
description: Live results and maps for the night of the Clinton v Trump showdown.

title: Index Funds Are Taking Over The S&P 500
description: A Wall Street Journal analysis of U.S.-based mutual fund and ETF ownership of the S&P 500 reveals that passive funds have more than doubled their stake in the index over the last decade.

title: Reacting to the Fed
description: How markets are reacting to today’s Federal Reserve statement, and how they’ve reacted after previous meetings.

title: How Oil’s Fall Has Flummoxed Forecasters
description: Since the price of oil began its decline in mid-2014, analysts at major investment banks have struggled to accurately predict its moves, both short- and long-term.

title: Brexit Vote: Live Results
description: Results from the U.K.’s referendum on EU membership, plus market reaction.

title: How Fed Rates Move Markets
description: See how Treasurys, mortgage rates, stocks and the strength of the dollar shift when the Federal Reserve changes interest rates.

title: Mapped: Europe’s Pollution Problem
description: See where average levels of nitrogen dioxide are over the legal limit across the continent.

title: The Unraveling of Tom Hayes
description: A five-part immersive longform feature on Libor “mastermind” Tom Hayes.

title: The Events That Pushed Greece to the Economic Brink
description: Annotated timeline of Greek and Germany bond yields in relation to the Greek financial crisis.

title: How Eurozone GDP Stacks Up
description: Tracking GDP growth in the first quarter of 2015 in Eurozone countries as it was reported.

title: U.K. Election Results 2015
description: Live results of the May 7, 2015 U.K. general election and exit poll forecasts, as well as how the market was reacting.

title: Eurozone Bonds' Wild Ride
description: See how the eurozone crisis has led to an unprecedented era in European bond markets.

title: Greece's Debt Due: What Greece Owes When
description: Greece is negotiating with its eurozone creditors to get more aid before the indebted government runs out of cash.

title: How the Paris Shooting and Hostage Standoff Unfolded
description: French police faced off with gunmen on two fronts, as suspects behind the murderous attack on French magazine Charlie Hebdo and the shooting dead of a police woman took hostages after a two-day manhunt. Here is how events unfolded.
